channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk and His Friends Help Trump Shake Up the Government
item.description: The billionaire and his Silicon Valley allies landed in the capital and immediately moved to cut the size of the federal government, reprising the pla...

item.title: Half of wealthy Gen Zers and millennials admit to ‘digital shoplifting,’ rationalizing it with inflation and influencer hacks
item.description: Customers are duping merchants into issuing refunds even if they receive and keep their products.

item.title: JPMorgan vet and Luminary founder keeps a shortlist of businesses she’d like to acquire—and tells all founders do the same
item.description: Cate Luzio's company just announced a deal to buy HeyMama, digital membership-based community.

item.title: Trump’s Middle East Envoy Visits Israel in Show of Support for Gaza Cease-Fire

item.title: Trump to federal employees on ‘fork in the road’: Quit now and collect eight months’ pay for nothing
item.description: Almost all civil servants can opt to resign now and get paid through September without showing up for work—but Senator Tim Kaine warns it's a trick.

item.title: Stampede at India’s Maha Kumbh Mela Hindu Festival: Many Feared Dead

item.title: Inside a Chaotic U.S. Deportation Flight to Brazil
item.description: The Trump administration’s first flight deporting Brazilians involved aborted takeoffs, sweltering heat, emergency exits and shackled deportees on a w...

item.title: DeepSeek used OpenAI’s model to train its competitor using ‘distillation,’ White House AI czar says
item.description: David Sacks says OpenAI has evidence that Chinese company DeepSeek used a technique called "distillation" to build a rival model.

item.title: Stampede Breaks Out During Major Hindu Festival in India

item.title: How vitamin B12 could give you an energy boost
item.description: A B12 deficiency can cause issue ranging from exhaustion to neurological problems.

item.title: The F.D.A. Upgraded a Recall of Some Lay’s Potato Chips. Here’s What to Know.

item.title: Student Threatened With Expulsion Over Social Posts Gets $250,000 Settlement
item.description: The University of Tennessee threatened to expel Kimberly Diei over posts the school said were inappropriate. She sued on First Amendment grounds.

item.title: Menendez Co-Conspirator Sentenced to 7 Years as Ex-Senator Awaits Fate
item.description: Robert Menendez, a former senator from New Jersey, faces a potentially lengthy prison sentence after his conviction on federal corruption charges.
